H0.text: which body system differentiates a male from a female. Endocrine System

H1.text: which body system differentiates a male from a female. Nervous System

H2.text: which body system differentiates a male from a female. Muscular System

H3.text: which body system differentiates a male from a female. reproductive

A4.text: the sexes of differentiated species often have significant differences. These differences allow for a combination of genetic material between two individuals, which allows for the possibility of greater genetic fitness of the offspring.

A5.text: the male reproductive system has one function, and it is to produce and deposit sperm. The female reproductive system has two functions: The first is to produce egg cells, and the second is to protect and nourish the offspring until birth.
